alt: Marseille France
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond

alt: Henriette Koblinsky Mazzia's favourite place to catch the Marseille's dazzing sunsets is on the sea at Point Rouge Beach (Credit: Henriette Koblinsky)
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond

alt: OTCM To get a real sense of the city's history, head to Mazzia's pick, the baroque Vieille Charité almshouse (Credit: OTCM)
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond

alt: Jade Orengo It's tough to get a room for the night, but you can explore beautiful Les Goudes, with its unique architecture and errant roosters (Credit: Jade Orengo)
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond

alt: Alamy Mazzia's favourite place to enjoy Marseille's famous fresh seafood is La Boîte à Sardine on Boulevard de la Libération (Credit: Alamy)
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond

alt: Alamy Marseille's Notre Dame de la Garde basilica can be seen from nearly any corner of the city, including the Bompard; Mazzia's favourite evening stroll (Credit: Alamy)
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond

alt: Pauline Coutant There's certainly room in your suitcase for some of the handicrafts and herbs to be found along Rue d'Aubagne (Credit: Pauline Coutant)
article_heading: Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia's favourite ways to enjoy Marseille during the Olympics and beyond
